intro: Trichodrymonia splendens, commonly known as the splendour spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has smooth, succulent leaves and stems that store water, adapting it to arid environments. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in some regions.
